name: Dinner Tonight: Green Lentil Salad with Baby Spinach and Goat Cheese
description: The inspiration for this dinner began when I came across David Lebovitz's post about authentic French Puy lentils ("the caviar of lentils"), a wonderful pantry staple for quick sides and light meals. French green lentils (especially the certified "de Puy"...
recipeIngredient: 1 cup French green lentils (ideally "de Puy" variety)
a few springs of fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon dry
1 tablespoon red wine or sherry vinegar

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the lentils then add them to a small pot with the bay leave and thyme. Cover with water by a few inches and bring to a boil. Season with a pinch of salt, then turn down heat and simmer until tender but not overcooked, about 30 minutes.

In the meantime, combine the shallot, mustard, and vinegar in a bowl or small glass jar. Season with a little salt and pepper, then allow to sit for a few minutes to soften the shallot. Add the oil in a slow stream, whisking to create a vinaigrette (or cover the jar and shake until emulsified).

When the lentils are cooked, drain and return to the pot. Toss immediately with the vinaigrette. Add the baby spinach just before turning out into plates, so it only just begins to wilt. Top with the goat cheese and freshly ground black pepper and serve warm.
